text:
- eHealth New South
Wales is the digital arm
of New South Wales Health

which is Australia's largest
public health system.

Our organisation's mission
is to support digital
transformation and digital enablement
of New South Wales Health.

Critical to our success in
driving digital transformation
of New South Wales Health are the skills
and competencies of our staff.

eHealth New South Wales Digital
Academy is a great example

of our strong commitment
to workforce development

and in particular training
and development of our staff.
- When we started the Cloud Academy,
it was for a specific purpose.

It was a training program
more than anything else.

As we scaled the environment
and we had more and more
of our staff joining the academy,

we soon realised that
it could have more power
being more than a training program.

- The Digital Academy
is a holistic approach
to building skills and capabilities.
The learning is delivered

through a variety of
offerings from short, sharp,

45 second quick reference
videos, face to face training,

be it live or through webinars,
through online modules

all the way through to really
fun and exciting game days

and hackathons where we
bring our people together
to compete and solve problems.

And I have to say this
is the most exciting part

of the Digital Academy
because this is where people

really shift the way they
think about doing their job.
From just technical transactions

to solving customer situations
with real live solutions.
- The types of training we deliver

are for the most of the
major skills capabilities
that people need to work in cloud.
So that would be solution architecture,
developing, operations,

and also into some more
specialised areas around security,
DevOps, and data and analytics.
- The Amazon Web Services learning team,

they helped us establish
as a learning team

what do we need to know to have
conversations with our SMEs.

What is industry leading in
terms of technical capability
and the delivery of learning offerings?

They taught us to not be
afraid to try new things
as a learning team

and they also made the
Digital Academy stronger

by helping us see what
industry best practice
partnerships look like.

- The scale of what eHealth's
been able to actually do here.

They were the first organisation
in the public sector

in Australia to actually
build out a program
of this scale and scope.

- By mid 2023, most of
eHealth New South Wales staff
will have completed the cloud stream.

- So we found that people
can apply the learnings
which is really important for us.
People are really enjoying it
and it's increasing staff engagement.
Overall, it's been really successful.

- The Digital Academy has
helped me hone my skills
understanding about the cloud,
looking at the various implications
of how you implement AWS security,

as well as how you can
optimise data analytics.

- I found Digital Academy
to be an incredible resource
to upscale myself in core cloud concepts

and enhance my knowledge
around AWS services

as well as get useful
hands on lab experience.
I'm also a proud achiever
of AWS Cloud practitioner certification

and it's adding to my
professional credentials.

- 81% of our learners
are celebrating the fact

that not only are they feeling
confident and competent
to do what they need to do on the job,

but they're now feeling
confident and competent
to learn new skills and capabilities.

- I think the biggest
advantages of Digital Academy

is the interactions
that we have with peers,

your interactions with the
highly qualified trainers,

as well as learning new
things which can be applied

to bring benefits to the
wider healthcare community
in New South Wales.
- The skills gap in Australia is real.

Australia will require
six and a half million
additional digital workers by 2025.
That's a 79% increase over 2020.

- AWS is in a unique position
to have clear visibility

around the globe of the fact
that there is a skills gap
that exists in cloud capabilities.

What this means is our
customers can't simply rely
on hiring to close their skills gap
or obtain the skills that they need.
They actually need to budget for
and invest in re-skilling their staff.

- As a cloud engineer,
I feel more confident
in performing challenging tasks

using my newly acquired skills
from the Digital Academy.

- We continue to evolve
and add to the Academy
to make sure that it's fit for purpose
and it allows the organisation to evolve
to make sure that eHealth New South Wales

can continue to provide
the service it needs
to New South Wales Health.
